tool_details.name: get_weather_array
tool_details.description:
Get weather for multiple cities - returns structured data. Input should
    be a list of city names . example input: ['London', 'Paris', 'Tokyo']

tool_details.name: get_weather_json
tool_details.description:
Get weather for multiple cities from JSON input. Each city can have location and unit settings.
    Example: {'pune':{'location':1,'unit':'celsius'},'mumbai':{'location':0,'unit':'fahrenheit'}}

custom_prompts.name: hello
custom_prompts.text: Say a energetic hello to the user!

custom_prompts.name: introduce
custom_prompts.text:
You are a helphul assistant called @config.BOTNAME and you are and expert in @config.DOMAIN

User name is @param.username
custom_prompts.description: Prompt to showcase use of variables and environment variables

custom_prompts.name: averagetemperatures
custom_prompts.text:
@tool.AllFeature.list_cities()

for the above list fetch the temperatures for each and give me the average temperature using the avgerage() tool
custom_prompts.description: Get the average temps across cities - use MCP tools and custom vMCP tools within prompts

custom_prompts.name: book_table
custom_prompts.text:
The current time is @tool.AllFeature.get_current_time(timezone_name: str = "UTC")

User is at @tool.AllFeature.get_location(city: str = "@config.CITY")

Book a table with AllFeature.book_table() for @param.party_size 1 hour from now
custom_prompts.description: Use tool outputs in prompts and variables as tool parameter

custom_tools.name: create_blog_post
custom_tools.description: Use this tool to create a new blog post with a title and body content. Returns the created post with a generated ID.

body.title: Getting Started with MCP Tools
body.body: This guide will walk you through creating your first MCP HTTP tool

body_parsed.title: Getting Started with MCP Tools
body_parsed.body: This guide will walk you through creating your first MCP HTTP tool

custom_tools.name: get_blog_posts
custom_tools.description: Retrieves a specific blog post by its ID. Returns the complete post data including title, body, userId, and post ID.

custom_tools.name: list_blog_post
custom_tools.description: Retrieves a list of blog posts Supports pagination and filtering to find specific posts. Returns an array of post objects

custom_tools.name: get_headers
custom_tools.description: Get the details of the headers sent with API

custom_tools.name: get_header_through_config
custom_tools.description: Get headers passed to the api. this is dummy tool for testing http tools

custom_tools.name: check_auth
custom_tools.description: use this tool to check if the user is authenticated

custom_tools.name: count_characters_in_word
custom_tools.description: Use this tool to calculate how many characters are in a particular word
custom_tools.code:
def main(word:str, character:str):
  return word. count (character)

system_prompt.text:
You are a helpful AI assistant called @config.BOTNAME with access to various tools and resources. You can help users with a wide range of tasks using the available MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools.

Available capabilities:
- Execute tools to perform specific actions
- Access resources for information
- Use prompts for structured interactions

Always be helpful, accurate, and explain what you're doing when using tools.
